docs.abstract: In both pre-emptive and defensive ways, the social network is modifying its behavior to fend off antitrust concerns.
docs.snippet: In both pre-emptive and defensive ways, the social network is modifying its behavior to fend off antitrust concerns.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Senator Elizabeth Warren has called for the breakup of big tech companies like Facebook. Regulators have opened investigations into Facebook’s power in social networking. Even one of Facebook’s own founders has laid out a case for why the company needs to be split up.

headline.main: How Facebook Is Changing to Deal With Scrutiny of Its Power
headline.print_headline: Facebook Is Changing Over Antitrust Concerns

docs.abstract: Tax cuts and tariffs have not caused a significant return of factory activity, data from the government and other sources show.
docs.snippet: Tax cuts and tariffs have not caused a significant return of factory activity, data from the government and other sources show.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — From tax cuts to relaxed regulations to tariffs, each of President Trump’s economic initiatives is based on a promise: to set off a wave of investment and bring back jobs that the president says the United States has lost to foreign countries.

headline.main: Trump’s Push to Bring Back Jobs to U.S. Shows Limited Results
headline.print_headline: Trump’s Boasts vs. Reality In Luring Jobs Back to U.S.

docs.abstract: The country’s central bank guided the renminbi past another key point, suggesting Beijing could weaponize it if Trump imposes more tariffs.
docs.snippet: The country’s central bank guided the renminbi past another key point, suggesting Beijing could weaponize it if Trump imposes more tariffs.
docs.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — China signaled on Thursday that it might continue to weaken its currency, a move that threatens to again escalate the trade war with the United States.

headline.main: China Signals It Will Continue to Weaken Its Currency as Trade War Rages
headline.print_headline: China Signals It Will Keep Weakening Its Currency

docs.abstract: A full recertification of the troubled jet would be a major setback to Boeing, but analysts say such a move is unlikely.
docs.snippet: A full recertification of the troubled jet would be a major setback to Boeing, but analysts say such a move is unlikely.
docs.lead_paragraph: SHEFFIELD, Mass. — A group of family members representing more than 50 people who died in the crash of Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302 are calling on the Federal Aviation Administration to conduct a full regulatory review of Boeing’s 737 Max before it is allowed to fly again.

headline.main: Boeing 737 Max Needs Full F.A.A. Review, Crash Families Say
headline.print_headline: Victims’ Families Call For Full F.A.A. Review Of Boeing 737 Max

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Boeing 737 Max Groundings and Safety Concerns (2019)

docs.abstract: President Trump has made no secret of his frustration that the United States dollar has strengthened against other currencies.
docs.snippet: President Trump has made no secret of his frustration that the United States dollar has strengthened against other currencies.
docs.lead_paragraph: The trade war between Washington and Beijing took an unexpected turn this week as China let its currency drop sharply and the United States responded by officially designating the country a currency manipulator.

headline.main: Trump Wants a Weaker Dollar. Getting One Isn’t So Easy.
headline.print_headline: The Tricky Task Of Weakening The Dollar

docs.abstract: David Rubin is the first person in that category to helm the 92-year-old Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, which oversees the Oscars.
docs.snippet: David Rubin is the first person in that category to helm the 92-year-old Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences, which oversees the Oscars.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences named David Rubin its new president on Tuesday, making him the first casting director to be the public face of the 92-year-old institution best known for overseeing the Oscars.

headline.main: Film Academy Elects a Casting Director as Its New President
headline.print_headline: Motion Picture Academy, in a First, Elects a Casting Director as Its President

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: ACADEMY OF MOTION PICTURE ARTS AND SCIENCES

docs.abstract: Beijing’s signals suggest it is ready to retaliate should the White House follow through on its new tariff threat, with potentially disruptive results.
docs.snippet: Beijing’s signals suggest it is ready to retaliate should the White House follow through on its new tariff threat, with potentially disruptive results.
docs.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — China may turn its currency into a weapon. It has already stopped buying American crops. Its mining industry stands ready to hold back minerals that are crucial to making iPhones and missiles, and its policymakers are openly discussing doing without American trade.

headline.main: ‘Weaponized’ Currency and Mining Limits: China’s Responses to Trump Take Shape
headline.print_headline: China Looks to Currency and Mining to Fight U.S.

docs.abstract: Families are often reluctant to talk about wealth and inheritance with their children, but experts say that can create confusion and insecurity.
docs.snippet: Families are often reluctant to talk about wealth and inheritance with their children, but experts say that can create confusion and insecurity.
docs.lead_paragraph: Parents would be remiss if they did not talk to their children about drinking and driving, using drugs and, of course, sex. Some go even further, discussing subjects like bullying and mental health.

headline.main: 4 Reasons Parents Don’t Discuss Money (and Why They Should)
headline.print_headline: The Birds and the Bees. Why Not Bequests?

docs.abstract: In France, there are few takers for tens of thousands of manufacturing jobs, despite one of Europe’s highest unemployment rates. Now, the industry is being pushed to burnish its allure.
docs.snippet: In France, there are few takers for tens of thousands of manufacturing jobs, despite one of Europe’s highest unemployment rates. Now, the industry is being pushed to burnish its allure.
docs.lead_paragraph: OYONNAX, France — Along a vast alpine plain, hundreds of factories are cranking out plastic perfume bottles, automobile parts and industrial tools. Trucks chug through mountains ferrying thousands of ready-made wares for export. On billboards and warehouses, “We’re hiring!” signs flutter in the breeze.

headline.main: In an Industrial Corner of France, 18,000 Jobs Are On Offer. Why Aren’t People Taking Them?

docs.abstract: Mr. Black of Apollo Global Management has not addressed the stakes that he, his sons and Mr. Epstein took in a company after Mr. Epstein’s guilty plea on a sex charge.
docs.snippet: Mr. Black of Apollo Global Management has not addressed the stakes that he, his sons and Mr. Epstein took in a company after Mr. Epstein’s guilty plea on a sex charge.
docs.lead_paragraph: Leon D. Black, whose Apollo Global Management is among the world’s largest private equity firms, has gone to great lengths to distance himself from Jeffrey Epstein, the wealthy financier accused of sex trafficking.

headline.main: Leon Black Plays Down Ties to Jeffrey Epstein but Is Silent on 2011 Deal
headline.print_headline: Apollo Chief Says Link To Epstein Was Limited

byline.original: By Matthew Goldstein and Jessica Silver-Greenberg
